item.title: 甲骨文 3000 亿美元的人工智能赌注已迅速成为泡沫晴雨表
item.description:
硅谷正处于又一次史诗般的繁荣之中，而拉里-埃里森（Larry Ellison）正是甲骨文公司的核心人物，无论好坏。【原文：

Silicon Valley is in the midst of another epic boom, and Larry Ellison has Oracle right at the center of it, for better or worse.

】

item.title: 欧盟立法者将考虑放宽对最安全银行债券的资本规定
item.description: 欧盟立法者将考虑降低对担保债券的监管要求，作为更广泛的资本市场改革的一部分。【原文：European Union lawmakers are set to consider adopting lower regulatory requirements for covered bonds as part of a broader overhaul of capital markets.】

item.title: 甲骨文将OpenAI的部分数据中心项目推迟至2028年
item.description: 据熟悉这项工作的人士透露，甲骨文公司已将其为人工智能模型开发商OpenAI开发的一些数据中心的完工日期从2027年推迟到2028年。【原文：Oracle Corp. has pushed back the completion dates for some of the data centers it’s developing for the artificial intelligence model developer OpenAI to 2028 from 2027, according to people familiar with the work.】

item.title: 米莱减税，顶级银行押注阿根廷农业繁荣
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）正在拆除经济壁垒，包括削减种植者的出口关税，阿根廷的两大银行正寻求为农民开放更多信贷。【原文：Two major banks in Argentina are seeking to open up more credit for farmers as President Javier Milei tears down economic barriers, including chopping export tariffs for growers.】

item.title: 美联储官员对 2026 年经济面临的更大风险意见不一
item.description: 美联储官员（包括两位将于2026年成为选民的官员）周五就如何处理利率问题发表了强烈的反对意见，这场争论将持续到新的一年。【原文：Federal Reserve officials — including two who will become voters in 2026 — offered strongly opposing views Friday on what to do with interest rates, continuing a debate that will grip the US central bank into the new year.】

item.title: 受利率趋势影响，主要银行股有望实现第三周上涨
item.description: 美国大型银行的股价将连续第三周上涨，这是自8月份以来最长的连涨纪录，此前，在一次行业会议上，最新消息助长了人们的乐观情绪，认为这些银行将继续受益于经济复苏以及短期和长期利率差距的扩大。【原文：Shares of big US banks are headed to a third straight weekly gain, the longest winning streak since August, after updates at an industry conference fueled optimism that they’ll continue benefiting from a resilient economy and the widening gap between short- and long-term interest rates.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行出售大量资产以兑现资本承诺
item.description: 让-洛朗-邦纳费（Jean-Laurent Bonnafe）没有浪费任何时间来安抚投资者。【原文：Jean-Laurent Bonnafe isn’t wasting any time to reassure investors.】

item.title: 荷兰债券销售向短债倾斜，养老金发生变化
item.description: 荷兰政府正在将其借贷向短期债券倾斜，以应对市场需求的变化，以及对该国 1.7 万亿欧元（约合 2 万亿美元）养老金行业的全面改革将进一步削弱长期证券购买力的预期。【原文：The Dutch government is tilting its borrowing toward shorter-term bonds in response to shifts in market demand and the expectation that an overhaul of the nation’s €1.7 trillion ($2 trillion) pension industry will further weaken buying of long-term securities.】

item.title: 美联储行动后美国 30 年期收益率创 9 月以来新高
item.description: 随着本周美联储降息和政策立场的影响传入市场，长期国债下跌，30 年期国债收益率升至 9 月初以来的最高水平。【原文：Long-term Treasuries fell, lifting the 30-year bond’s yield to the highest level since early September, as the implications of this week’s Federal Reserve interest-rate cut and policy stance filtered into the market.】

item.title: 特朗普政府在网络攻势中求助于私营公司
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府正准备求助于私营企业，帮助他们对外国对手发动进攻性网络攻击，这可能会扩大通常由秘密情报机构进行的不为人知的电子冲突。【原文：President Donald Trump’s administration is preparing to turn to private businesses to help mount offensive cyberattacks against foreign adversaries, according to people familiar with the matter, potentially expanding a shadowy electronic conflict typically conducted by secretive intelligence agencies.】

item.title: 最高法院就特朗普关税问题做出裁决时应关注的股票
item.description: 美国最高法院即将就唐纳德-特朗普总统 4 月份推出的全面关税措施的合法性作出裁决，这可能是对一直高歌猛进的股市的下一个考验。【原文：An upcoming US Supreme Court ruling on the legality of the sweeping tariffs that President Donald Trump rolled out in April — briefly sending markets worldwide into a tailspin — could be the next test for stocks that have been flying high.】

item.title: 千禧年以超过 30 亿美元的资金支持两位对冲基金经理
item.description: 千禧年管理公司（Millennium Management）又支持了两家外部管理公司，资金总额超过 30 亿美元，这是该对冲基金巨头最近一系列拨款中的最新一笔。【原文：Millennium Management has backed two more external managers with more than $3 billion in combined capital, the latest in a series of recent allocations by the hedge fund giant.】

item.title: 投资者纷纷撤离科技巨头，S&P 500 指数出现波动
item.description: 周五，美国股市出现波动，大型科技股下滑，而投资者则转向股市的其他领域，包括旧经济公司和小型公司。【原文：US equities fluctuated Friday as megacap technology shares slumped while investors gravitated toward other corners of the stock market, including old-economy and small-cap companies.】

item.title: 必和必拓合资公司为大型铜矿项目寻求阿根廷激励措施
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）的一家合资企业提交了加入阿根廷投资激励计划的申请，该项目位于一个希望成为下一个主要铜生产中心的地区。【原文：A BHP Group venture submitted an application to join Argentina’s investment incentives program for a project in an area it hopes will be the next major production hub for copper.】

item.title: 美联储主席哈马克表示她倾向于略微放宽利率限制
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，她更希望利率限制略微严格一些，以保持对通胀的压力，因为通胀率仍然过高。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said she would prefer interest rates to be slightly more restrictive to keep putting pressure on inflation, which is still running too high.】

item.title: 南非着手放宽规则，允许马斯克的 "星链 "进入南非
item.description: 南非电信部长指示行业监管机构修订其关于本地所有权的规定，这可能会为埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司和其他卫星互联网公司在不出让所有权的情况下在南非这个非洲大陆最大的经济体开展业务铺平道路。【原文：South Africa’s telecommunications minister directed the industry regulator to amend its rules on local ownership, which could pave the way for Elon Musk’s SpaceX and other satellite-internet companies to operate in the continent’s largest economy without ceding ownership.】

item.title: 斯洛伐克新任债务主管预计 2026 年债券销售额高达 110 亿欧元
item.description: 斯洛伐克新任债务管理负责人认为，投资者对欧元区主权债券发行者的态度将更加挑剔，因此斯洛伐克预计明年的借贷需求将减少多达 20 亿欧元（23 亿美元）。【原文：Slovakia expects its borrowing needs to drop by as much as €2 billion ($2.3 billion) next year as the country’s new debt management chief sees a more selective investor approach to sovereign bond issuers in the euro area.】

item.title: 人工智能园区租户终止 1.5 亿美元交易后，费米公司下跌 43
item.description: Fermi Inc.周五暴跌43%，原因是这家由德克萨斯州前州长里克-佩里（Rick Perry）共同创办的电力开发商称，一名租户终止了一项价值1.5亿美元的协议，该协议与其在德克萨斯州西部拟建的人工智能园区有关。【原文：Fermi Inc. plunged as much as 43% on Friday after the power developer, co-founded by former Texas governor Rick Perry, said a tenant terminated a $150 million agreement tied to its proposed artificial intelligence campus in West Texas】

item.title: 加拿大私人借贷机构利用新工具模仿阿波罗游戏规则
item.description: 赛富集团（SAF Group）正在向长期以来由阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.如果其他公司跟进，此举将有助于重塑加拿大私人信贷市场的轮廓。【原文：SAF Group is charging into a corner of private credit long dominated by Apollo Global Management Inc. and Brookfield Corp., launching an insurance-backed investment vehicle to fuel lending to borrowers starved of flexible financing. If followed by others, the move could help redraw the contours of the Canadian private credit market.】

item.title: 美国扣押委内瑞拉油轮可能加剧经济痛苦
item.description: 美国在委内瑞拉沿海扣押了一艘受制裁的油轮，委内瑞拉面临新的金融冲击，此举可能会扼杀这个再次濒临恶性通货膨胀边缘的国家为数不多的收入来源之一。【原文：Venezuela faces a fresh financial shock after the US seized a sanctioned oil tanker off its coast, a move that could choke off one of the few remaining revenue streams for a nation again on the brink of hyperinflation.】

item.title: 对冲基金经理看错股票涨势，仍获得 79% 的收益
item.description: 比尔-哈尼奇不相信股票会上涨。但他还是成功了。【原文：Bill Harnisch didn’t believe in the stock rally. He still crushed it.】

item.title: 美联储保尔森认为劳动力市场面临的风险大于通货膨胀
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长安娜-保尔森（Anna Paulson）周五表示，她预计明年通胀将降温，但她提醒说，劳动力市场有进一步下滑的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Anna Paulson said Friday she expects inflation to cool next year though she cautioned there is a risk of a further downturn in the labor market.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比表示，他认为明年的缩表幅度将超过大多数人
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，他预计 2026 年的降息幅度将超过许多同事，但他反对本周降息，因为他希望等待更多的通胀数据。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said he is projecting more interest-rate cuts for 2026 than many of his colleagues, but dissented against a rate cut this week because he wanted to wait for more data on inflation.】

item.title: 德国因网络攻击激增召见俄罗斯特使
item.description: 德国外交部召见了俄罗斯驻柏林大使，并明确表示，莫斯科政府支持的旨在破坏民主的混合攻击将承担后果。【原文：Germany’s foreign ministry summoned the Russian ambassador in Berlin and said it made it clear there’ll be consequences for hybrid attacks backed by the government in Moscow aimed at undermining democracy.】

item.title: 中国计划针对汽车制造商的价格战制定更严格的法规
item.description: 中国市场监管部门发布了新的指导方针草案，旨在阻止汽车制造商对车型定价过于低廉，以遏制加剧通货紧缩压力的恶性竞争。【原文：China’s market regulator released new draft guidelines aimed at stopping automakers from pricing models too cheaply as part of efforts to curb cutthroat competition that’s fueling deflationary pressure.】

item.title: 欧盟同意对小包裹临时征收 3 欧元税费以打击中国
item.description: 欧盟将从明年开始对小包裹征收更高的费用，以遏制主要来自中国的包裹涌入。【原文：The European Union will impose higher fees on small packages starting next year in an attempt to curb the influx of parcels coming mostly from China.】

item.title: 油轮冷战升温
item.description: 用船舶将石油运往世界各地已不再是一门枯燥乏味的生意。【原文：Hauling petroleum around the world in ships is no longer a humdrum business.】

item.title: 据说日本央行认为加息周期可能超过 0.75
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本央行官员认为，在加息周期结束之前，利率很可能会升至 0.75% 以上，这表明在普遍预期的下周加息之后，可能还会有更多的加息。【原文：Bank of Japan officials consider it likely that interest rates will rise above 0.75% before their rate hike cycle is over, according to people familiar with the matter, a sign that more increases may be in store after a widely expected move next week.】

item.title: 英伟达 H200 AI 芯片可能在中国上演第二幕
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，伊恩-金（Ian King）将重温英伟达（Nvidia）的一款早期人工智能芯片。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King revisits one of Nvidia’s earlier-generation AI chips that has returned to the spotlight.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟竞标者日子不好过
item.description: 华纳兄弟 Discovery Inc. 的竞购者们本周经历了一场艰难的角逐。这将排除拍卖的可能性吗？别指望了。【原文：The dueling suitors for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. have had a rough week. Will this rule out an auction? Don’t count on it.】
